content:
Create Smart Links with the Link Tool in Salesforce Classic

Add a smart link from one Salesforce Knowledge article to another by manually entering the article URL in the rich text editor.

Available in: Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience

Salesforce Knowledge is available in the Unlimited Edition with Service Cloud. It's available for an additional cost in Professional, Enterprise, Performance, and Developer Editions.

To create articles:

Manage Articles
Read and Create on the article type

Highlight content or place cursor where you want to add the link.
Click the link icon.
For Link Type, select URL.
Enter the article URL as /articles/[language]/[articleType]/[URLName].
Example: /articles/en_US/FAQ/About-Passwords
Optionally, select where the referenced article displays on the Target tab.
Click OK.

Smart links use more characters than displayed in the editor. If you surpass the character limit, have your administrator increase it.

SEE ALSO

Insert Smart Links into Articles
Create Persistent Links to Lightning Knowledge Articles
title: Creating Smart Links in Salesforce Classic
